title: University of Hawaii awarded $5.4M in federal grants for Native Hawaiian education
content:
The University of Hawaii will be awarded $1.8 million federal grants over the next three years to support education efforts for Native Hawaiians.

The $5.4 million from the U.S. Department of Education is directed for a preschool educator-parent-student readiness program, along with cultural “place-based” learning programs at public charter school Ka Waihona o ka Kaauao and Nanakuli Intermediate and High School.

“These awards are a testament to our amazing faculty and staff on our campuses…
